class_notes: (Co-Requisite ENGRD 223) For Questions, contact psyrf@emory.edu IDS205W addresses: Why do we believe what we do and what role does science play in this? What is the nature of scientific evidence? What counts as evidence in science versus other disciplines? How do they affect our everyday lives? Each semester, these broad issues are brought to bear on a pressing social issue.  For example, in past years, the focus has been on political elections, environmental justice, and suffering and death. This semester, we will focus on medical uncertainty.  The pandemic has highlighted enduring questions about how scientific progress is made in the context of ongoing research that creates as many questions as it answers, as well as the ways in which individuals experience uncertainty around their own health decisions in the context of inequities and barriers to health care. The course will follow the same basic format of weekly readings and discussions, and a series of short paper across the semester culminating in a final group project/presentation.
